### Description
As a developer, I want `distDocker` to conform to what is typically expcted of tasks, that they rebuild any dependencies. Recompiling and distributing the reassembled code into the docker image seems like it should be automatically triggered.

### Acceptance Criteria
* `./gradlew distDocker` will reflect code changes from the last time this command was run.

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. `./gradlew clean`
2. Edit `main` in `besu.java` to
```
  public static void main(final String... args) {
    final Logger logger = setupLogging();
    logger.info("1");
    System.exit(0);
```
3. run `./gradlew --parallel distDocker && docker run hyperledger/besu:1.4.7-SNAPSHOT` (or whatever your snapshot version is) and observe the `1`
4. Edit `main` in `besu.java` to
```
  public static void main(final String... args) {
    final Logger logger = setupLogging();
    logger.info("2");
    System.exit(0);
```
5. run `./gradlew --parallel distDocker && docker run hyperledger/besu:1.4.7-SNAPSHOT` and observe the `1`
6. `./gradlew --parallel clean distDocker && docker run hyperledger/besu:1.4.7-SNAPSHOT` and observe the `2`

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: `8589177e49740e5ad533f99819de88fa35c82933`
@davemec definitely optional but fixing this (or finding a workaround) would make iterating on the hive tests a much faster experience since you won't have to recompile besu from scratch each time.
